text: Introduction
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I found myself in Twilight Land. How I ever got there I cannot tell, but
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: there I was in Twilight Land.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: What is Twilight Land? It is a wonderful, wonderful place where no sun
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: shines to scorch your back as you jog along the way, where no rain falls
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: to make the road muddy and hard to travel, where no wind blows the dust
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: into your eyes or the chill into your marrow. Where all is sweet and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: quiet and ready to go to bed.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Where is Twilight Land? Ah! that I cannot tell you. You will either have
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: to ask your mother or find it for yourself.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: There I was in Twilight Land. The birds were singing their good-night
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: song, and the little frogs were piping "peet, peet." The sky overhead
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: was full of still brightness, and the moon in the east hung in the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: purple gray like a great bubble as yellow as gold. All the air was full
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: of the smell of growing things. The high-road was gray, and the trees
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: were dark.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I drifted along the road as a soap-bubble floats before the wind, or as
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: a body floats in a dream. I floated along and I floated along past the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: trees, past the bushes, past the mill-pond, past the mill where the old
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: miller stood at the door looking at me.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I floated on, and there was the Inn, and it was the Sign of Mother
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Goose.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The sign hung on a pole, and on it was painted a picture of Mother Goose
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: with her gray gander.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: It was to the Inn I wished to come.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I floated on, and I would have floated past the Inn, and perhaps have
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: gotten into the Land of Never-Come-Back-Again, only I caught at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the branch of an apple-tree, and so I stopped myself, though the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: apple-blossoms came falling down like pink and white snowflakes.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The earth and the air and the sky were all still, just as it is at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: twilight, and I heard them laughing and talking in the tap-room of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the Inn of the Sign of Mother Goose--the clinking of glasses, and the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: rattling and clatter of knives and forks and plates and dishes. That was
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: where I wished to go.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: So in I went. Mother Goose herself opened the door, and there I was.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The room was all full of twilight; but there they sat, every one of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: them. I did not count them, but there were ever so many: Aladdin, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Ali Baba, and Fortunatis, and Jack-the-Giant-Killer, and Doctor Faustus,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and Bidpai, and Cinderella, and Patient Grizzle, and the Soldier who
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: cheated the Devil, and St. George, and Hans in Luck, who traded and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: traded his lump of gold until he had only an empty churn to show for it;
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and there was Sindbad the Sailor, and the Tailor who killed seven flies
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: at a blow, and the Fisherman who fished up the Genie, and the Lad who
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: fiddled for the Jew in the bramble-bush, and the Blacksmith who made
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Death sit in his apple-tree, and Boots, who always marries the Princess,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: whether he wants to or not--a rag-tag lot as ever you saw in your life,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: gathered from every place, and brought together in Twilight Land.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Each one of them was telling a story, and now it was the turn of the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Soldier who cheated the Devil.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I will tell you," said the Soldier who cheated the Devil, "a story of a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: friend of mine."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Take a fresh pipe of tobacco," said St. George.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Thank you, I will," said the Soldier who cheated the Devil.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: He filled his long pipe full of tobacco, and then he tilted it upside
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: down and sucked in the light of the candle.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Puff! puff! puff! and a cloud of smoke went up about his head, so that
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: you could just see his red nose shining through it, and his bright eyes
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: twinkling in the midst of the smoke-wreath, like two stars through a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: thin cloud on a summer night.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I'll tell you," said the Soldier who cheated the Devil, "the story of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: a friend of mine. Tis every word of it just as true as that I myself
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: cheated the Devil."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: He took a drink from his mug of beer, and then he began.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Tis called," said he--
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The Stool of Fortune
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Once upon a time there came a soldier marching along the road, kicking
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: up a little cloud of dust at each step--as strapping and merry and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: bright-eyed a fellow as you would wish to see in a summer day. Tramp!
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: tramp! tramp! he marched, whistling as he jogged along, though he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: carried a heavy musket over his shoulder and though the sun shone hot
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and strong and there was never a tree in sight to give him a bit of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: shelter.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: At last he came in sight of the King's Town and to a great field of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: stocks and stones, and there sat a little old man as withered and brown
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: as a dead leaf, and clad all in scarlet from head to foot.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Ho! soldier," said he, "are you a good shot?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Aye," said the soldier, "that is my trade."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Would you like to earn a dollar by shooting off your musket for me?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Aye," said the soldier, "that is my trade also."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Very well, then," said the little man in red, "here is a silver button
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: to drop into your gun instead of a bullet. Wait you here, and about
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: sunset there will come a great black bird flying. In one claw it carries
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: a feather cap and in the other a round stone. Shoot me the silver button
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: at that bird, and if your aim is good it will drop the feather cap and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the pebble. Bring them to me to the great town-gate and I will pay you a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: dollar for your trouble."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Very well," said the soldier, "shooting my gun is a job that fits me
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: like an old coat." So, down he sat and the old man went his way.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Well, there he sat and sat and sat and sat until the sun touched the rim
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: of the ground, and then, just as the old man said, there came flying a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: great black bird as silent as night. The soldier did not tarry to look
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: or to think. As the bird flew by up came the gun to his shoulder, squint
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: went his eye along the barrel--Puff! bang--!
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I vow and declare that if the shot he fired had cracked the sky he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: could not have been more frightened. The great black bird gave a yell so
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: terrible that it curdled the very blood in his veins and made his hair
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: stand upon end. Away it flew like a flash--a bird no longer, but a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: great, black demon, smoking and smelling most horribly of brimstone,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and when the soldier gathered his wits, there lay the feather cap and a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: little, round, black stone upon the ground.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Well," said the soldier, "it is little wonder that the old man had
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: no liking to shoot at such game as that." And thereupon he popped
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the feather cap into one pocket and the round stone into another, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: shouldering his musket marched away until he reached the town-gate, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: there was the old man waiting for him.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Did you shoot the bird?" said he.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I did," said the soldier.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "And did you get the cap and the round stone?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I did."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Then here is your dollar."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Wait a bit," said the soldier, "I shot greater game that time than
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I bargained for, and so it's ten dollars and not one you shall pay me
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: before you lay finger upon the feather cap and the little stone."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Very well," said the old man, "here are ten dollars."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Ho! ho!" thought the soldier, "is that the way the wind blows?"--"Did I
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: say ten dollars?" said he; "twas a hundred dollars I meant."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: At that the old man frowned until his eyes shone green. "Very well,"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: said he, "if it is a hundred dollars you want, you will have to come
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: home with me, for I have not so much with me." Thereupon he entered the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: town with the soldier at his heels.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Up one street he went and down another, until at last he came to a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: great, black, ancient ramshackle house; and that was where he lived. In
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: he walked without so much as a rap at the door, and so led the way to
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: a great room with furnaces and books and bottles and jars and dust and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: cobwebs, and three grinning skulls upon the mantelpiece, each with a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: candle stuck atop of it, and there he left the soldier while he went to
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: get the hundred dollars.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The soldier sat him down upon a three-legged stool in the corner and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: began staring about him; and he liked the looks of the place as little
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: as any he had seen in all of his life, for it smelled musty and dusty,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: it did: the three skulls grinned at him, and he began to think that the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: little old man was no better than he should be. "I wish," says he, at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: last, "that instead of being here I might be well out of my scrape and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: in a safe place."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Now the little old man in scarlet was a great magician, and there was
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: little or nothing in that house that had not some magic about it, and of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: all things the three-legged stool had been conjured the most.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I wish that instead of being here I might be well out of my scrape,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and in a safe place." That was what the soldier said; and hardly had the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: words left his lips when--whisk! whir!--away flew the stool through the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: window, so suddenly that the soldier had only just time enough to gripe
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: it tight by the legs to save himself from falling. Whir! whiz!--away it
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: flew like a bullet. Up and up it went--so high in the air that the earth
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: below looked like a black blanket spread out in the night; and then down
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: it came again, with the soldier still griping tight to the legs, until
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: at last it settled as light as a feather upon a balcony of the king's
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: palace; and when the soldier caught his wind again he found himself
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: without a hat, and with hardly any wits in his head.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: There he sat upon the stool for a long time without daring to move, for
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: he did not know what might happen to him next. There he sat and sat, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: by-and-by his ears got cold in the night air, and then he noticed for
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the first time that he had lost his head gear, and bethought himself of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the feather cap in his pocket. So out he drew it and clapped it upon his
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: head, and then--lo and behold!--he found he had become as invisible as
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: thin air--not a shred or a hair of him could be seen. "Well!" said he,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "here is another wonder, but I am safe now at any rate." And up he got
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: to find some place not so cool as where he sat.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: He stepped in at an open window, and there he found himself in a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: beautiful room, hung with cloth of silver and blue, and with chairs and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: tables of white and gold; dozens and scores of waxlights shone like so
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: many stars, and lit every crack and cranny as bright as day, and there
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: at one end of the room upon a couch, with her eyelids closed and fast
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: asleep, lay the prettiest princess that ever the sun shone upon. The
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: soldier stood and looked and looked at her, and looked and looked at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: her, until his heart melted within him like soft butter, and then he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: kissed her.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Who is that?" said the princess, starting up, wide-awake, but not a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: soul could she see, because the soldier had the feather cap upon his
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: head.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "It is I," said he, "and I am King of the Wind, and ten times greater
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: than the greatest of kings here below. One day I saw you walking in your
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: garden and fell in love with you, and now I have come to ask you if you
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: will marry me and be my wife?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "But how can I marry you?" said the princess, "without seeing you?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "You shall see me," said the soldier, "all in good time. Three days
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: from now I will come again, and will show myself to you, but just now it
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: cannot be. But if I come, will you marry me?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Yes I will," said the princess, "for I like the way you talk--that I
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: do!"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Thereupon the soldier kissed her and said good-bye, and then stepped
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: out of the window as he had stepped in. He sat him down upon his
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: three-legged stool. "I wish," said he, "to be carried to such and such a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: tavern." For he had been in that town before, and knew the places where
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: good living was to be had.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Whir! whiz! away flew the stool as high and higher than it had flown
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: before, and then down it came again, and down and down until it lit as
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: light as a feather in the street before the tavern door. The soldier
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: tucked his feather cap in his pocket, and the three-legged stool under
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: his arm, and in he went and ordered a pot of beer and some white bread
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and cheese.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Meantime, at the king's palace was such a gossiping and such a hubbub as
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: had not been heard there for many a day; for the pretty princess was not
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: slow in telling how the invisible King of the Wind had come and asked
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: her to marry him; and some said it was true and some said it was not
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: true, and everybody wondered and talked, and told their own notions of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the matter. But all agreed that three days would show whether what had
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: been told was true or no.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: As for the soldier, he knew no more how to do what he had promised to do
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: than my grandmother's cat; for where was he to get clothes fine enough
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: for the King of the Wind to wear? So there he sat on his three-legged
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: stool thinking and thinking, and if he had known all that I know he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: would not have given two turns of his wit upon it. "I wish," says he, at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: last--"I wish that this stool could help me now as well as it can carry
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: me through the sky. I wish," says he, "that I had a suit of clothes such
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: as the King of the Wind might really wear."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The wonders of the three-legged stool were wonders indeed!
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Hardly had the words left the soldier's lips when down came something
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: tumbling about his ears from up in the air; and what should it be but
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: just such a suit of clothes as he had in his mind--all crusted over with
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: gold and silver and jewels.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Well," says the soldier, as soon as he had got over his wonder again,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "I would rather sit upon this stool than any I ever saw." And so would
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: I, if I had been in his place, and had a few minutes to think of all
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: that I wanted.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: So he found out the trick of the stool, and after that wishing and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: having were easy enough, and by the time the three days were ended the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: real King of the Wind himself could not have cut a finer figure. Then
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: down sat the soldier upon his stool, and wished himself at the king's
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: palace. Away he flew through the air, and by-and-by there he was, just
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: where he had been before. He put his feather cap upon his head, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: stepped in through the window, and there he found the princess with her
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: father, the king, and her mother, the queen, and all the great lords and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: nobles waiting for his coming; but never a stitch nor a hair did they
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: see of him until he stood in the very midst of them all. Then he whipped
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the feather cap off of his head, and there he was, shining with silver
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and gold and glistening with jewels--such a sight as man's eyes never

text: treasure. Tell me upon the instant where it is; for the half of it, by

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

text: very angry. "What," cried he, "do you amuse me by such an absurd and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: as the other two had been, lit as they had been by a carbuncle in the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: room, he was like a man turned drunk with wonder. He had to lean against
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: desires."

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

text: The Good of a Few Words
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: There was one Beppo the Wise and another Beppo the Foolish.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The wise one was the father of the foolish one.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo the Wise was called Beppo the Wise because he had laid up a great
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: treasure after a long life of hard work.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo the Foolish was called Beppo the Foolish because he spent in five
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: years after his father was gone from this world of sorrow all that the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: old man had laid together in his long life of toil. But during that time
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo lived as a prince, and the life was never seen in that town before
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: or since--feasting and drinking and junketing and merrymaking. He had
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: friends by the dozen and by the scores, and the fame of his doings went
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: throughout all the land.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: While his money lasted he was called Beppo the Generous. It was only
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: after it was all gone that they called him Beppo the Foolish.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: So by-and-by the money was spent, and there was an end of it.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Yes; there was an end of it; and where were all of Beppo's fair-weather
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: friends? Gone like the wild-geese in frosty weather.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Don't you remember how I gave you a bagful of gold?" says Beppo the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Foolish. "Won't you remember me now in my time of need?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: But the fair-weather friend only laughed in his face.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Don't you remember how I gave you a fine gold chain with a diamond
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: pendant?" says Beppo to another. "And won't you lend me a little money
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: to help me over to-day?"
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: But the summer-goose friend only grinned.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "But what shall I do to keep body and soul together?" says Beppo to a
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: third.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The man was a wit. "Go to a shoemaker," said he, "and let him stitch the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: soul fast;" and that was all the good Beppo had of him.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Then poor Beppo saw that there was not place for him in that town, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: so off he went to seek his fortune else whither, for he saw that there
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: was nothing to be gained in that place.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: So he journeyed on for a week and a day, and then towards evening he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: came to the king's town.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: There it stood on the hill beside the river--the grandest city in the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: kingdom. There were orchards and plantations of trees along the banks
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: of the stream, and gardens and summer-houses and pavilions. There were
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: white houses and red roofs and blue skies. Up above on the hill were
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: olive orchards and fields, and then blue sky again.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo went into the town, gazing about him with admiration. Houses,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: palaces, gardens. He had never seen the like. Stores and shops full
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: of cloths of velvet and silk and satin; goldsmiths, silversmiths,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: jewellers--as though all the riches of the world had been emptied into
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the city. Crowds of people--lords, noblemen, courtiers, rich merchants,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and tradesmen.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo stared about at the fine sights and everybody stared at Beppo, for
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: his shoes were dusty, his clothes were travel-stained, and a razor had
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: not touched his face for a week.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The king of that country was walking in the garden under the shade of
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the trees, and the sunlight slanted down upon him, and sparkled upon the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: jewels around his neck and on his fingers. Two dogs walked alongside
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: of him, and a whole crowd of lords and nobles and courtiers came behind
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: him; first of all the prime-minister with his long staff.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: But for all this fine show this king was not really the king. When the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: old king died he left a daughter, and she should have been queen if she
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: had had her own rights. But this king, who was her uncle, had stepped in
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: before her, and so the poor princess was pushed aside and was nobody at
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: all but a princess, the king's niece.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: She stood on the terrace with her old nurse, while the king walked in
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: the garden below.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: It had been seven years now since the old king had died, and in that
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: time she had grown up into a beautiful young woman, as wise as she was
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: beautiful, and as good as she was wise. Few people ever saw her, but
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: everybody talked about her in whispers and praised her beauty and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: goodness, saying that, if the right were done, she would have her own
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and be queen.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Sometimes the king heard of this (for a king hears everything), and he
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: grew to hate the princess as a man hates bitter drink.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The princess looked down from the terrace, and there she saw Beppo
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: walking along the street, and his shoes were dusty and his clothes were
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: travel-stained, and a razor had not touched his face for a week.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Look at yonder poor man," she said to her nurse; "yet if I were his
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: wife he would be greater really than my uncle, the king."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The king, walking below in the garden, heard what she said.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Say you so!" he called out. "Then we shall try if what you say is
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Alas!" said the princess, "now, indeed, have I ruined myself for good
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and all."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo was walking along the street looking about him hither and thither,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and thinking how fine it all was. He had no more thought that the king
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and the princess were talking about him than the man in the moon.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Suddenly some one clapped him upon the shoulder.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo turned around.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: There stood a great tall man dressed all in black.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "You must come with me," said he.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "What do you want with me?" said Beppo.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "That you shall see for yourself," said the man.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: "Very well," said Beppo; "I'd as lief go along with you as anywhere
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: else."
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: So he turned and followed the man whither he led.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: They went along first one street and then another, and by-and-by they
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The man in black entered, and Beppo followed at his heels, wondering
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: where he was going.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: He was in a garden. There were fruit trees and flowering shrubs and long
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: was not a soul to be seen anywhere.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The tall man in black led the way up the long marble walk, past the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: fountains and fruit trees and beds of roses, until he had come to the
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: palace.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo wondered whether he were dreaming.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: The tall man in black led the way into the palace, but still there was
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: not a soul to be seen.
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: Beppo gazed about him in wonder. There were floors of colored marble,
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: and ceilings of blue and gold, and columns of carved marble, and
title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: hangings of silk and velvet and silver.

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

text: king.

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

text: black.

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land
author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

author: Pyle, Howard

title: Twilight Land

author: Pyle, Howard

text: to be taken. One time," said the old man, "I myself had three sons--as
